snippet: It has been a week of uncomfortable self-examination for the people in charge of some of England's dearest old traditions, from soccer games on Saturday afternoons to Sunday morning church services.
abstract: It has been a week of uncomfortable self-examination for the people in charge of some of England's dearest old traditions, from soccer games on Saturday afternoons to Sunday morning church services.

headline.main: England Faces Modern Britain — From Race and Soccer to Women Bishops and Gay Rights
